body.p: This document is a reference to the JavaScript and JSP/Facelets entry points to JavaServer(TM) Faces Technology Extensions Dynamic Faces (DynaFaces).

section.name: JSP/Facelets tags
section.p: For complete reference materials, see the TagLibrary Documentation.

subsection.name: Scripts Component
subsection.p: Convenience component for rendering all the scripts necessary for using the jsf-extensions ajax feature. Place this inside <f:view> yet before any usages of the AJAX JavaScript objects. Subsequent occurrences of this tag in the page will produce no output.
Please see the tag library documentation for details.

subsection.name: AjaxZone Component
subsection.p: Convenience component marking the regions of a page that should be updated via AJAX. When using this component, you do not need to use the Scripts component because the zone will cause the required scripts to be rendered.
Please see the tag library documentation for details.

source.code: <jsfExt:ajaxZone id="zone2" interactionType="input" inspectElement="inspectElement" eventType="click" collectPostData="extractParams" action="#{carstore.currentModel.updatePricing}"> <!-- JSF and HTML content goes here. --> </jsfExt:ajaxZone>

section.name: JavaScript Functions
section.p: This section lists the JavaScript functions and classes exposed by the DynaFaces JavaScript library.

subsection.name: DynaFaces.fireEvent
subsection.p: When invoked, causes an AJAX request with the specified options to be sent to the Faces server immediately. The response to this request comes in the form of an XML document that is parsed by the DynaFaces JavaScript library and used to update the DOM of the current view.

Where ANY_HTML_OR_JSF_ELEMENT is any jsf component or HTML element from which you emit the event, THIS is a JavaScript reference to the HTML element given earlier, |EVENT| is any javascript event supported by that element, such as onmousedown, onclick, onblur, etc, and { |OPTIONS| } is an optional argument that is a JavaScript associative array supporting the following options.

dl.dd: boolean value. True by default. If false the ajax request will be made asynchronously.

dd.p: Comma separated string containing a list of client ids against which the execute portion of the request processing lifecycle must be run. If the value of the option is the single string "none" without the quotes, the execute portion of the lifecycle will be effectively skipped. If this option is not specified at all, the value of the render parameter is used as the value of the option. If that is not specified, the entire view is traversed during the execute portion of the request proecssing lifecycle.

Comma separated string containing a list of client ids against which the render portion of the request processing lifecycle must be run. If not specified, the entire view is rendered. If the value of the option is the single string "none" without the quotes, the render portion of the lifecycle will be effectively skipped.

Comma separated string containing a list of client ids of input elements whose values should be submitted to the server. If not specified, all the values of all input elements in the current form are submitted.

If specified, must be the only option, and must conform to the above syntax, where |CLIENT_ID| is the client id of the component to be the source of the event, |EVENT_NAME| is a JavaBeans property name of an event method on the component identified by the |CLIENT_ID| parameter, and the optional immediate value indicates that the event should run during apply request values, rather than invoke application.
If specified, this is a JavaScript object is kept locally and passed to the replaceElement and/or the postInstallHook callback functions.

If specified, this is a JavaScript associative array object that will be sent up to the server in the X-JSON header. This value may be operated on by the server. The possibly modified value will be returned to the client as the last argument in the replaceElement and/or the postInstallHook callback functions.
The name of a globally scoped function that conforms to the following signature.

This function is called for each component that needs to be re-rendered with data from this ajax response. The function is expected to take the content of the content argument and replace the DOM element referenced by the id argument. The function is expected to invoke any scripts that may be present in content. The optional argument closure is whatever was passed as the closure option to the DynaFaces.fireEvent or DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent that initiated the ajax request for this response. The optional argument xjson is whatever was passed as the xjson option to the DynaFaces.fireEvent or DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent that initiated the ajax request for this response. The xjson agrument is passed to the server and may have been modified by the server.
The name of a globally scoped function that conforms to the following signature.

This function is called after the markup replacement for each component that needs to be re-rendered with data from this ajax response. The optional argument closure is whatever was passed as the closure option to the DynaFaces.fireEvent or DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent that initiated the ajax request for this response. The optional argument xjson is whatever was passed as the xjson option to the DynaFaces.fireEvent or DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent that initiated the ajax request for this response. The xjson agrument is passed to the server and may have been modified by the server.

subsection.name: DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent
subsection.p: This function extends the functionality of DynaFaces.fireEvent and uses the Prototype Event.observe feature to cause a DynaFaces.fireEvent call to be emitted from a specific element in the DOM when the specified JavaScript event occurs. The options supported are exactly the same as in DynaFaces.fireEvent.

Where ELEMENT is a JavaScript reference to a DOM element that is to be instrumented with AJAX behavior. EVENT_STRING_LITERAL is a string, with or without the "on" prefix, that must be a JavaScript event type. Examples include, "click", "blur", "mouseover", etc. |OPTIONS| is as specified above, in the section DynaFaces.fireEvent.

source.pre:
<script type="text/javascript">

  // Assume there is code to populate the associative array
  // elements with elements that should be AJAXified.  

  options = new Object();

  // Assume there is code to populate the options.  The set of
  // supported options is described previously in the section
  // DynaFaces.fireEvent.

  var element;
  for (var e in elements) {
    element = elements[e];
    DynaFaces.installDeferredEvent(e, "click", options);
  }
